title: The Origin of 'PEZ'
fact: The name 'PEZ' comes from the German word 'Pfefferminz,' which means 'peppermint,' the original flavor of PEZ candies. It's derived from the first, middle, and last letters of 'Pfefferminz'.

title: PEZ Candy Bricks
fact: PEZ candies are uniquely shaped like bricks, measuring 15mm in length, 8mm in width, and 5mm in height.

title: A Collector's Delight
fact: PEZ dispensers have become a part of pop culture and are collected worldwide, especially in the United States.

title: PEZ's Humble Beginnings
fact: PEZ was created by Eduard Haas III in Vienna in 1927, and the first dispenser was introduced in 1949.

title: PEZ Goes to America
fact: PEZ entered the American market in 1953 and signed their first licensing contract with Disney Enterprises in 1962.

title: Beyond Candy
fact: PEZ dispensers often feature characters from various animation studios, particularly Disney, but there are also regional variations like American football or NASCAR.

title: PEZ for Pets
fact: There are even PEZ toys for dogs that operate on the same principle as the dispensers for humans.

title: PEZ Flavors
fact: While PEZ offers a variety of flavors, classic flavors include chocolate, cola, and various fruits. There are also strong flavors like watermelon and green apple, and even sugar-free options.
